metadata.Title: CVE-2020-8832 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The fix for the Linux kernel in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS for CVE-2019-14615 ("The Linux kernel did not properly clear data structures on context switches for certain Intel graphics processors.") was discovered to be incomplete, meaning that in versions of the kernel before 4.15.0-91.92, an attacker could use this vulnerability to expose sensitive information. Gregory Herrero discovered that the fix for CVE-2019-14615 to address the Linux kernel not properly clearing data structures on context switches for certain Intel graphics processors was incomplete. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-8832` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1063-aws - 4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1075-azure - 4.15.0-1075.80
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1058-gcp - 4.15.0-1058.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-91-lowlatency - 4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: sbeattie> this issue is Ubuntu specific and only affects 4.15 kernels.

criterions.comment: linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1063.67~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1075.80').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1058.62').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-91.92~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1035.38~16.04.1').
